doc:
Ray Bolger https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ray_Bolger 0 Raymond Wallace Bolger (January 10, 1904 – January 15, 1987) was an American film and television actor, vaudevillian, TV presenter, singer, dancer (particularly of tap) and stage performer (particularly musical theatre) who started in the silent film era. He was a major Broadway performer in the 1930s and beyond (see below). He is best known for his role as the Scarecrow and his Kansas counterpart farm worker "Hunk" in MGM's classic The Wizard of Oz (1939) and the villainous Barnaby in Walt Disney's musical fantasy Babes in Toyland. He was also the host of his eponymous television show, The Ray Bolger Show. Raymond_Wallace_Bolger ( January_10_,_1904 – January_15_,_1987 ) was an_American_film_and_television_actor , vaudevillian , TV_presenter , singer , dancer ( particularly of tap ) and_stage_performer ( particularly_musical_theatre ) who started in the_silent_film_era . He was a_major_Broadway_performer in the_1930s and beyond (_see below ) . He is_best_known for his_role as the_Scarecrow and his_Kansas_counterpart_farm_worker_"_Hunk " in MGM 's_classic The Wizard of Oz_(_1939_) and the_villainous_Barnaby in Walt_Disney 's_musical_fantasy_Babes in Toyland . He was also the_host of his_eponymous_television_show , The_Ray_Bolger_Show .
